title: Barbeque-Spice-Rubbed Skirt Steak
ingredients: 1 teaspoon Spanish smoked paprika (La Chinata is the best)
instructions: To make the spice rub: Combine all the ingredients in a small bowl.
To make steaks:  Combine the balsamic vinegar, cider vinegar, corn oil and ketchaup in a bowl.  Add the skirt steaks and marinate for 2 hours.

Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 375˚F.  Remove the steaks, blot the excess marinade with a paper towel, and rub both sides with the spice rub.  Heat a 12-inch cast-iron skillets over medium-high heat until just smoking.  Generously film the bottom with corn oil to prevent the spices from burning.  Cut the steaks in half so they fit in the pan.  Working two pieces at a time, sear the steaks for 3 minutes on each side transferring to baking sheet when each batch is done.  Place pan in oven and cook until the internal temperature is 115˚F  to 125˚F, about 6 minutes.  Let rest for 3 to 4 minutes before cutting.
Server the steaks topped with the charred onions and jalapenos.
